basic_info.description: Unë jam një inxhinier elektrik dhe roboticist. Puna ime kërkimore është e përqendruar në Robot Vision dhe Cybersecurity. Ajo konsistaton më së shumti në krijimin e mjeteve dhe produkteve që ndihmojnë në përmirësimin e jetës së njerëzve dhe avancimin e punëve të tyre kërkimore. Aktualisht synoj të kem titullin e doktorit të shkencave duke ndihmuar në përparimin e njohurive të njerëzimit në Elektronikë e Robotikë. Dega e studimit që kam zgjedhur, kryesisht ka të bëjë me Inxhinierinë Elektrike, ndërsa puna ime kërkimore përshin një gamë të gjerë fushash duke filluar nga konverterat analog në dixhital të frekuencave të larta, bioresiztenca, modelim në CAD, Computer Vision deri në Neuroimazheri dhe aplikime të inteligjencës artificiale në Robotikë. Nëpërmjet studimeve të mia kam si qëllim të arrij një formim teknik sa më të plotë e të gjithanshëm. Në këtë mënyrë unë mund të zbatoj njohuritë e një fushe teknike të caktuar për të qartësuar këndveshtrimë të reja inovatore në fusha të tjera. Puna ime e deritanishme është publikuar në konferenca prestigjoze ndërkombëtare të IEEE si IROS, ICRA etj. Në vijim mund të ndiqni një përshkrim të disa prej punëve dhe kërkimeve të mia më të rëndësishme bashkangjitur linqeve përkatëse për më shumë informacion.

projects.title: The Pressure is on You
projects.description: This project was part of the Embedded Systems Class in Spring 2021. The objective was to build a semiautomated blood pressure and heart rate measuring device by interfacing with an I2C Honeywell ® Pressure Sensor through an ATmega32u4 microcontroller. In order to challenge ourselves further, our group decided to use pyserial in order to plot the pressure measurements in real time and create a user interface that allows for data to be imported from older time points or collected in real time from scratch.

projects.title: Multi-Robot Simulation Framework
projects.description: Our team developed a framework that bridges the gap between mobile printing robots and realistic material simulations. This framework that includes particle-based viscoelastic fluid simulation and particle-to-mesh conversion in the widely adopted Gazebo robotics simulator, avoiding the bottlenecks of traditional additive manufacturing simulation approaches. This framework is the first of its kind  that enables the simulation of robot arms or mobile manipulators together with viscoelastic fluids.

projects.title: Heart Rate Measurement PCB
projects.description: This project was the finalization of my Electronics I class. The heart rate monitor connects to the electrode and outputs the final QRS waveform that can be measured with an oscilloscope connected to the exposed pins. An extensive literature review was performed on the physiology of the generation of the cardiac muscle signal and the forms of its conduction. The ECG device was implemented with a right lec circuit for the common mode rejection, an instrumentation amplifier tested on Cadence Virtuoso and an active band-pass filter along with the necessary decoupling capacitors. Altium was used to prepare the final PCB for manufacture.

projects.title: Cellular Resource Allocation
projects.description: Cells are complex biochemical systems functioning under finite resources which are shared between growth and production. The process and outcomes of this allocation are not fully understood. This paper details a model consisting of coupled differential equations that seeks to shed light over this phenomena. This deterministic model focuses on allocation trade-offs and is based on a sufficient level of complexity that does not obscure the core biochemistry of the products. Equations used to model the spread of epidemics were adapted for such purposes.

projects.title: Volatect - iGEM 2019
projects.description: I was project manager of the engineering research and development team in the summer for my university's iGEM team which was competing in the Diagnostics Track. Our project is named Volatect: a point of care diagnostics device coupled with a results database and API, enabling the swift detection, surveillance and control of epidemic-prone diseases. The novel DETECTR technique, combining Recombinase Polymerase Amplification and CRISPR-Cas12, is applied to collected saliva samples on a proprietary microfluidic chip to detect a customizable assay of infectious diseases.

projects.title: Explore Mars Competition
projects.description: This is the first project of my undergraduate research career and it proposes a theoretical model of Molten Salt Reactor and an ANSYS Fluent simulation. The chosen fuel and the plane design were meant to enhance low speed travel and exploration. Thorium was chosen due its inability to be weaponized and its abundance both on Earth and Mars. The plane is meant to push humanity to a new age of exploration and sustainable living on a terraformed Mars.
